name: Imre Lakatos
background: Hungarian philosopher of mathematics and science. Student of Popper. Developed methodology of scientific research programmes. Created 'proofs and refutations' approach to mathematical discovery.

principles.name: Progressive vs degenerating research programmes
principles.description: Judge theories by whether they predict novel facts (progressive) or just accommodate known anomalies (degenerating). A degenerating programme defended ad hoc should be abandoned.
principles.falsification: When even degenerating programmes retain value pending better alternatives

principles.name: Proofs and refutations drive discovery
principles.description: Mathematical knowledge grows through conjectures, proofs, counterexamples, and proof revisions. Discovery is dialectical, not deductive. Counterexamples improve rather than destroy theories.
principles.falsification: In formal systems where proof is mechanical verification, not creative discovery

principles.name: Research programmes have hard cores and protective belts
principles.description: Theories have unfalsifiable cores protected by auxiliary hypotheses. When anomalies arise, modify the protective belt, not the core. Only abandon cores when alternatives prove more progressive.
principles.falsification: When rigid commitment to a degenerating research programme blocks progress
